summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Judge Paul A. Engelmayer, requesting a one-week extension for a status report in a FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein. The extension is needed to review interviews of BOP staff Michael Thomas and Tova Noel conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General as part of their deferred prosecution agreements.

persons.name: Paul A. Engelmayer
persons.context: Presiding judge over the FOIA case The New York Times Co. v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. He grants the extension request.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York whose office represents the defendant, the Federal Bureau of Prisons, in the FOIA case.

persons.name: Steven J. Kochevar
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signs and submits the extension request letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: A defendant in United States v. Noel (19 Cr. 830) who entered a deferred prosecution agreement and was interviewed by the DOJ-OIG regarding activities related to his employment, likely concerning the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: A defendant in United States v. Noel (19 Cr. 830) who entered a deferred prosecution agreement and was interviewed by the DOJ-OIG regarding activities related to her employment, likely concerning the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and convicted sex offender whose records are the subject of the FOIA lawsuit brought by The New York Times against the BOP.

connections.description: Both are defendants in the same criminal case (United States v. Noel) and both entered deferred prosecution agreements requiring interviews with the DOJ-OIG regarding their employment activities.
Kochevar is an Assistant U.S. Attorney acting under the authority of U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss in representing the BOP.
Kochevar, as an AUSA, is formally corresponding with and making a request to Judge Engelmayer, who presides over the case.

events.title: Deferred Prosecution Agreements Entered
events.description: Judge Tones entered deferred prosecution agreements for defendants Michael Thomas and Tova Noel in United States v. Noel (19 Cr. 830).

events.title: DOJ-OIG Interviews of BOP Staff
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General completed interviews of Michael Thomas and Tova Noel regarding their compliance with deferred prosecution agreements. The interviews were conducted in person.

events.title: Court Grants Extension Request
events.description: Judge Paul A. Engelmayer granted the government's request for a one-week extension of the status report deadline in the FOIA case.

keyFacts: The New York Times is suing the Federal Bureau of Prisons under FOIA for records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The government requested an extension to review the results of DOJ-OIG interviews with BOP staff Michael Thomas and Tova Noel, who were subjects of deferred prosecution agreements.
The interviews were related to the defendants' 'activities ... related to [their] employment,' which contextually points to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in BOP custody.
The deferred prosecution agreements required the defendants to 'truthfully and completely disclose all information' to the DOJ-OIG.
Judge Paul A. Engelmayer granted the one-week extension for the status report from July 9, 2021, to July 16, 2021.
